thread.title: U.S. women's hockey team doesn't flinch as USA Hockey deadline passes

author: USA TODAY Sports
title: U.S. women's hockey team doesn't flinch as USA Hockey deadline passes
text:
Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email U.S. women's hockey team doesn't flinch as USA Hockey deadline passes Thursday's deadline set by USA Hockey passed, and the U.S. women's team didn't budge. Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs U.S. women's hockey team doesn't flinch as USA Hockey deadline passes A.J. Perez , USA TODAY Sports Published 5:47 p.m. ET March 16, 2017 | Updated 7 minutes ago CLOSE x Share USA TODAY Sports' A.J. Perez explains why the USA women's hockey team is boycotting the upcoming International Ice Hockey Federation (IIHF) World Championship. USA left wing Hilary Knight (21) celebrates after scoring a goal against Canada during the second period in an exhibition hockey game at Air Canada Centre. (Photo: Tom Szczerbowski-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
The 5 p.m. ET Thursday deadline set by USA Hockey expired. The women’s national hockey team’s threatened boycott of the International Ice Hockey Federation (IIHF) World Championship didn’t. Two-time Olympian Jocelyne Lamoureux-Davidson told USA TODAY Sports that none of the 23 players on the roster came off their vow to skip the world championship as they seek better wages and other support from USA Hockey. USA Hockey had set the deadline earlier Thursday ahead of the tournament, set to begin at month's end.
